text: Enables/disables Al Haikk in Immortal Empires
Enables/disables Al Haikk in Immortal Empires Expanded
Enables/disables Al Haikk in The Old World

The largest of them all is the Palace of the Great Sultan. It is famous for its riches and luxuries, with large libraries brimming with ancient and unique books and temples decorated with idols of the Djinn, the gods of Araby.

Corsairs and merchants from all walks of life can be found here, all focused on one task — to make as much coin as possible; it doesn’t matter how it’s done. It is also the largest port for the slave trade.
The Grand Bazaar is the biggest market and the pulsating heart of Al Haikk. Magic items, fragrant spices, exotic animals and slaves are traded here.
Temples of the Djinn, to which the faithful come to pray and make offerings. Those built in Al Haikk are among the largest in all of Araby.
A place for the nomadic tribes to put aside their petty squabbles and unify as one in such dire times.

The Arabyan Guard — those dedicated to guarding the Sultans and Caliphs — are stationed in designated barracks that lie within the royal palaces for absolute protection. None would dare step within these premises.
